amendment.description: Amendment provided that the bill does not in any way limit access for hunting, fishing, trapping or recreational shooting on the 27 million acres administered by the Bureau of Land Management nor infringe on a state's right to manage, control or regulate its hunting, fishing, trapping and recreational shooting activities on these lands.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 6 printed in House Report 110-573 to provide that the bill does not in any way limit access for hunting, fishing, trapping or recreational shooting on the 27 million acres administered by the Bureau of Land Management. It also provides that H.R. 2016 does not in any way infringe on a state's right to manage, control or regulate its hunting, fishing, trapping and recreational shooting activities on these lands.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Altmire amendment (A006) Agreed to by recorded vote: 416 - 5 (Roll no. 171).
